<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 9"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Helpful Halfling](/Feats.aspx?ID=1021) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Halfling" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=87" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 45 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering. On a critical success to [Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=75), you grant your ally a +3 circumstance bonus if you have expert proficiency in the skill (rather than +2), and you grant your ally a +4 circumstance bonus if you have master proficiency (rather than +3). If you roll a critical failure on a check to Aid, you don’t give your ally a –1 circumstance penalty to their check.
name: Helpful Halfling
